page.title: 02LANDSCAPE AT TEVIOTHEAD
page.content: LANDSCAPE OF TEVIOTHEAD DISTRICT IS THAT OF ROUNDED,SOMETIMES STEEP HILLS RISING FROM THE RIVER VALLEYS OF THE TEVIOT AND FROSTLIEBURN.THE SCHOOL IS A T-SHAPED BUILDING OF BRICK, ROUGHCAST WHITE,SET WITHIN A PLAYGROUND OF GRASS AND TARMAC. THE VILLAGE HALL IS BUILT ON A BRICK BASE,ROUGHCAST,HAS WOOD WALLS AND A CORRUGATED IRON ROOF.THE CHURCH IS STONE BUILT WITH A STEEP SLATED ROOF,OPEN BELL TOWER,BESIDE THE NEW CEMETERY.WITHIN THE OLD CHURCHYARD LAY THE CHAPEL OF ST.MARY'S OF CAERLANRIG. HERE ALSO STAND SEVERAL INTERESTING TOMBSTONES.DERELICT STONE COTTAGES ARE FOUND AT PHAUP.& SOUTHDEANRIG SHIEL. A MODERN TOILET BLOCK , SECLUDED BY TREES,STANDS IN THE PICNIC SITE BESIDE THE A7 ROAD.NATIONAL GRID ELECTRICITY PYLONS RUN PARALLEL TO RIVERS WHICH ARE BRIDGED AT DIFFERENT PLACES.
